title: Computational Fluid Dynamics
shortDescription: CFD, FEA, thermal, and acoustic simulations for engineering precision.
longDescription: Our simulation engineers run high-fidelity computational models — from airflow and structural stress to daylighting and acoustics — to predict performance before construction begins. Every simulation is calibrated against real-world measurements, giving clients confidence that the built outcome will match the design intent.

images.alt: CFD surface mesh of a building geometry prepared for airflow simulation
images.caption: High-resolution surface mesh generated for an external wind comfort study — fine-grained tessellation around façade edges ensures accurate boundary-layer capture in the CFD solver.

images.alt: Vertical section heatmap showing thermal stratification around a building
images.caption: Cross-sectional temperature heatmap reveals thermal stratification zones around the envelope — used to optimise façade insulation specification and HVAC zoning strategies.

images.alt: Section view of normalised wind velocity ratios at pedestrian level
images.caption: Normalised flow velocity ratio at pedestrian height — values above 1.0 flag wind-acceleration corridors, directly informing the placement of screen walls and canopies in the landscape design.

images.alt: Velocity-coloured streamline visualisation showing airflow deflection and wake vortices around a building cluster
images.caption: LIC streamline plot coloured by velocity magnitude — high-speed approach flow (red) wraps around the primary tower while a large recirculating wake vortex (blue) develops in the sheltered courtyard, identifying wind comfort risks at ground level.
